verbs.description: oppignorate (third-person singular simple present oppignorates, present participle oppignorating, simple past and past participle oppignorated)

entries.meaning: (transitive, obsolete) To pawn; to lay in pledge.
examples: Besides that, Ferdinando had but newly taken breath from the war with the Moors; and merchanded at this time with France for the restoring of the counties of Russignon and Perpignian, oppignorated to the French.
